posts.title: Restoring the Dry Forest
posts.description: Discover how we are working to recover the dry forest ecosystem in Guanacaste.
posts.content: The tropical dry forest is one of the most threatened ecosystems in the world. At Fundación Núa, we are implementing innovative reforestation techniques that include planting drought-resistant native species. Our team of biologists constantly monitors tree growth and the return of local fauna. This project seeks not only to restore flora but also to protect vital water sources for nearby communities.
posts.author: María Rodríguez

posts.title: The Importance of Biological Corridors
posts.description: Connecting forest patches to allow free movement of wildlife.
posts.content: Biological corridors are essential for maintaining the genetic diversity of species. Without them, animal populations become isolated, increasing the risk of local extinction. We are working with private farm owners to create living fences and passage zones that allow jaguars, tapirs, and monkeys to move safely between protected areas.
posts.author: Carlos Méndez

posts.title: Environmental Education in Rural Schools
posts.description: Empowering the next generation of nature guardians.
posts.content: We firmly believe that education is the key to long-term conservation. Our 'Forest Guardians' program visits rural schools every week to teach children about the importance of biodiversity, recycling, and respect for animals. Through games and practical activities, we are planting the seed of environmental awareness in Costa Rica's future.
posts.author: Ana Sofía Vargas

form.text:
Fundación Núa was born from the shared dream of a group of biologists, educators, and nature lovers in San Ramón de Alajuela. It all started in 2018, when we noticed the rapid degradation of local biological corridors and the devastating impact this had on wildlife.

What began as small weekend cleanup and reforestation days soon transformed into a community movement. We realized that to achieve real and lasting change, we needed a more formal structure that would allow us to manage resources, establish strategic alliances, and expand our educational reach.

After years of hard work, planning, and the immeasurable support of the San Ramón community, Fundación Núa was legally constituted. Today, we are an organization dedicated to active conservation, scientific research, and environmental education, working tirelessly to ensure that future generations inherit a green and vibrant Costa Rica. Our journey is just beginning, and every tree planted is a testament to our commitment to life.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: To conserve and restore Costa Rica's biodiversity through forest protection, scientific research, and environmental education, empowering communities to live in harmony with nature.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To be a leading organization in tropical conservation, recognized for creating sustainable models of coexistence between humans and wildlife, inspiring a global shift towards protecting our planet.

values.title: Values
values.text: Passion for nature, Scientific integrity, Community commitment, Transparency in action, and Hope for a sustainable future are the pillars that guide our every step.

objectives.title: Our Objectives
objectives.item1: Restore 500 hectares of dry and rainforest by 2030.
objectives.item2: Establish 10 new biological corridors in the western zone.
objectives.item3: Educate over 5000 students annually on conservation.
objectives.item4: Promote scientific research applied to local conservation.

expanded.title: A Day as a Volunteer
expanded.description: Volunteering at Fundación Núa is more than work; it is a deep connection with the earth. We start the day with the song of birds, learning about the native species we are going to plant. We work shoulder to shoulder with the local community, sharing stories and laughter. At the end of the day, you take away not only the satisfaction of having left a green footprint, but also new friends and a renewed purpose. Whether you come for a day or a month, your impact will last for generations.
